favourite.article: Oh Lord Jesus what a precious hymn to enjoy while I am dismayed. My dear brother is divorcing me after 30 yrs. How to go on, how to shepherd the children, how to see him in the meetings, I know not. My spirit grieves and I do not understand. But I praise God that He will take care of me even when assailed with these dangers fierce in my path, no matter what the test, no matter my failing heart. He gives peace. Lord Jesus I lean on Your breast and abide beneath the wings of Your love tonight. God will take care of me. God will take care of me. Lord Jesus, I trust in our Father to take care of me and my children. Lord Jesus I love You even now. Lord make me an overcomer thru letting the Triune God take care of my body, soul and spirit. I surrender to Your care, I trust in Your care. I hold on to nothing on this earth. Gain the increase of Yourself in me for the Body. What a waste if I don't gain You in this unbearable suffering.
This song has helped me through so much. Even as I go through severe anxiety now, listening to this makes it so much easier to cope with.
This song has a way of soothing my down spirits. Woke up feeling anxious this morning. God bless you....

I've been searching for the wordings of this song. I searched all my hymns including ss&s, I didn't get it. This night I jumped up when I got it. God bless you, as I'm writing it's playing to my heart live. Thanks. You made month end.

Just wanted to retire to bed at 12:00 am then song rang in my heart, then I quickly got hold of my android phone browsed the lyrics and then sang till my heart was refreshed, refilled, refired and reassured. May God bless you.
I saw a kid and parents singing it. Since then it has been my family's favorite tune. Had to search out the exact lyrics here....
This hymn teach me to be simple in life, just amen with this great fact: He will take care of you; God will take care of you! --- no more anxiety, no more loneliness, because He care for us ---
Very dear to my heart, God is always taking care of me.
Touches the soul. God is really taking care of me.
This was one of my favourite hymes while as a kid in deeper life Bible church, it just came upon my heart to sing so I searched on it here.
One of my favorite hymns. I woke up from a dream this morning singing it so I wanted to hear it and found your website. Thank you.
It is reassuring to know, God will take care of us, God will take care of us, God will take care of us. Amen.

This song has always encouraged me. While it doesn't mean God will keep us from hard situations, He proves Himself faithful in keeping us while in hard situations. And even those hard experiences draw us close to Him, refining our characters and preparing us for Eternity. All things truly do work together for us for good. And there is no tragedy death or sickness that can seperate us from His love. Be encouraged for soon like Stephen we'll see the Son of Man on the right hand of God and spend with Him all of eternity!
Thank you for having this song available. Been trying for months to find a copy and here it was on my tablet.....a most wonderful hymn. The Lord be with you and your family.

My husband was blessed with the most angelic voice. I heard him sing this many times in service at home on the road on our trips now when I am down in my old age missing many things of past some how this song will come on my BBN radio no matter who is singing I see and hear only his comforting voice I hear may be superstition to some but it is the most up lifting and most God glorying song.

I was at my lowest point in my life, wishing my life would end. No one to talk to and not hearing a word from God. I was all cried out and had no more voice to pray, and then this song came to me out of nowhere. It was a song that was sung in church when I was a little girl. I had not heard it for over 60 years and it is not a song we now sing in church, yet there it was in my head as clear as clear could be. God gave me this song to comfort me. It was His way of speaking to me. It touches every aspect of my life. Now when I am feeling down or wondering if God hears my prayers. I play this song on my phone and it gives me blessed assurances that Jesus is mine. AMEN... AMEN... AND AMEN

I learned this in Sunday school 70 years ago. Throughout the ups and downs of life, I always have felt it applies to me. But what of people who have believed it and, for instance, ended in the gas ovens at Auschwitz... I doubt that their last thoughts were... "God is taking care of me"...

Ran across this during my Abiding Time this morning. Takes me back 70 years to my childhood and realized what a rich heritage I've had with these gems. This hymn spoke columns to me this morning. Out problem is not sin behaviors. It is the state of independence.

This beautiful hymn is my life story. God has taken care of me in every trial and every danger in life--scarcity of money, anxiety, stress, suicidal thoughts, illnesses, adjusting to a new country, job loss--everything!
My niece is presently in ICU after a brain surgery for brain tumor. The whole family and friends need intensive prayer for God's healing mercy upon her life.
Dear Anonymous, I am praying for you and your daughter.

My daughter who has lost her license for life, then finally got it back, only to loose it again back in May to another DWI, and has all but been on house arrest with an in home breathalyzer... Had a wreck this evening...DWI, no license, hit another vehicle while traveling at high speed......... With 3 of my grandchildren, one her own, in the car with her. Everyone went to ER and ok....Kim has been taken to jail.
I am standing on this promise once again. My hospital is closing and I have to make some choices. I know God is leading me in a path for healing ministry and I am going to be obedient.

Down to my last few $$ and this am need to buy gas, but not knowing where the $$ would come from. Checked my account and realized a friend had made a deposit day before ytd. GOD has proven to me once again that He WILL indeed take care of me.

God will take care of you, He will take care of You, through every day He will take care of you God will take care of you. God has been taking care of us since we can remember. If He doesn't who else will? We would be in a most pitiful situation. He has to and He will for apart from Him we have no one, no one, no one at all anywhere in all the universe genuinely cares. But God does care. He has not once given up on us .
Just when I was low, You came to my mind.

Through all the changing scenes of life You O LORD have not changed you remain the same yesterday, today and forever therefore we are not dismayed. In the mist of the storms we know you are with us so we will not fear. Give us the faith to hold onto every word that you have spoken even this very word " BE NOT DISMAYED I WILL TAKE CARE OF YOU." AMEN.

This is, with other "jewels" (that's how I call the hymns), one of the most beautiful and encouraging hymn I grew up with. So many years and cultural aspects separate me from its author, and still I'm sure it ministered to her as it now does to me... by the action of the Holy Spirit. As I've been raised in an Italian Evangelical family, I mostly remember and sing it in Italian: "Dimenticar giammai potr√≤ Signor la Tua merc√®".. and as I sing it, I'm also transported in time, back when my grandma' used to sing it while cooking or sitting at church... Thanks God for these wonderful songs!

This hymn means a lot to me and to many of my friends. I have one blind and in a permanent care facility in California. I have played this over the phone and we sing it together. Yes, God will take care of everyone. What an assuring group of words.
I love this hymn. I have proven the words to be true. Our dear Heavenly Father really does take care.

As I was preparing/studying to teach our S.School lesson on Luke 6:17-36, I typed in the computer "Be not dismayed . . ." to get all the words and then I clicked on this web site to see the rest of the words. Then WOW ! I hear this wonderful old hymn with the piano accompaniment and the words. What a blessing!

Feeling overwhelmed and the Holy Spirit brought to mind to look up "Be not dismayed". This song came on and this is awesome, just what I needed to hear. Also listening to a minister on my cell speaking on the Holy Spirit. Yes Lord, You will take care of all our Problems.

I had just finished crying out to the Lord when this song came into my spirit. I am encouraged to continue trusting in the Lord for my deliverance. God's divine inspiration to the writer is still ministering today.

W. Stillman Martin had been invited to preach at a church a few hours away from his home. But his wife became ill that Sunday morning, and he was about to cancel his speaking engagement. Then his young son spoke up, "Father, don't you think that if God wants you to preach today, He will take care of Mother while you are away?" Martin made the trip, and when he returned home later that day he found that his wife had written this hymn in his absence. That evening, he composed the music. (Great Songs of Faith by Brown & Norton)
I love this song. It gives me strength and courage to take on new challenges.

I have just been diagnosed with colon cancer and this is the song that came into my spirit right after the Dr.'s news...my spirit has been singing it ever since and it is so comforting to know God is taking care of me and will be with me thru it all...blessings to all!
Right!! GOD is always taking care of us..
I was woken from my sleep to pray and this song came to me. It is a comfort to know when time are so overwelming that there is a Father God that will take care of His own.
God will always take of us. No matter the distance and over time. He will always keep us.
It reminds me of my childhood days at church. It's a blessing to hear these Godly spirituals again.

God knows our every need. He goes before us and even years ahead He knows and provides the way. When we are willing to obey Him and bless others He even blesses us at the same time. What a kind and generous Savior!
I like this song because it assures me that even though I'm far from family and friends and a bit lonely, God is with me and He'll take care of me. I woke up :( today but with this assurance, I'm :)

I am 29 and recently married. I have been very far from GOD since few years and have not been finding HIS will, doing everything on my own will and thoughts. And I am struck with a BIG problem in my career. I have been praying since three days about my career, and today, my colleague sent me this site to listen Down in the valley song, I enjoyed it and was looking for some other songs that I am aware of and I happened to hear to this song - God will take care of you, I know this song since my childhood, but today, tears rolled down my cheek as I am singing along with the lyrics. Every line of the song has a meaning and it directly talks to me about the situations am in. Awesome site!!! My thanksgiving to the Almighty LORD and to the team who made this website. I can now be rest assured because GOD will take care of my career, and my family and financial problems.

Thank you for this wonderful website. I just lost one of my very dear friends and fellow choir member on Jan 4th. The family wanted the choir to sing at the service. We wanted to try to pick something that was comforting yet uplifting and this is the perfect hymn. We as believers need to pray for those that have not accepted Jesus as their Lord and Savior. God will take of us, all we have to do is ask and let Him in our heart.

My daughter recently lost her husband and has become very anxious about life in general. This old hymn reminds me that if we put our trust in God, He will take care of all our problems. As another said, "it reminds me of how long God has been taking care of my family".

I have just been reading of the tremendous impact this song had on JC Penney, when he was just about 'down and out'. This is now ministering to me as I face unfavorable odds for employment, in a deteriorating economic environment. I must put my trust in the LORD Jehovah Jireh. To whom else can we hope?

My mother and father used to sing this song when I was a little girl. They sang it always when we took road trips. I'm doing a talk about anxiety for a church group, and am making bookmarks on cardstock with these words to give to the people who may want them. They will then have them when they are anxious and discouraged. I love this song and its words and tune. These older songs really have a message for us.
This is one of the songs that inspire many a heart especially those that have no one to turn to. God is the only source of comfort. And one thing I like about it, It is true He takes care of His own

I sang this song as a little girl. I came across it this morning and it touched something so deep in my heart. I have been grieving over my family and this song reminded me of how long the Lord has been watching over me.

The old songs of yesterday have the words that apply to us of the modern age, if not more than ever. The uplifting words of this song struck my heart as I was thinking, although living very humbly,will we ever be out of debt to this money loving world. Praise God, he loves and cares for us and not because of what we have or not have.

When I was a little girl and my Daddy's alcoholism was at its worst, Mother would sing this to her three daughters. Right after that, Daddy gave his heart to Jesus and became a preacher. Since then many songs have become meaningful, but this one remains a favorite.
